required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Effects of EECP on Circulation, Blood Glucose Level and Blood Pressure in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effects of EECP on Circulation, Blood Glucose Level and Blood Pressure in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

lead_sponsor.agency: David Grant U.S. Air Force Medical Center

clinical_study.source: David Grant U.S. Air Force Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this proposed Department of Defense study is to evaluate the effect of Enhanced External Counterpulsation (EECP) on circulation, blood glucose control and blood pressure of type 2 diabetic patients receiving EECP therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in TCOM (Transcutaneous oximetry measurement) values
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline & post intervention, expected to be on average 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in hemoglobin A1C laboratory values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline & post intervention, expected to be on average 30 minutes

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in mean resting peripheral blood pressure
other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline & post intervention, expected to be on average 10 minutes

study_pop.textblock: Department of Defense type 2 diabetic patients enrolled in the Travis AFB, CA EECP clinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age equal to or greater than 18.
2. Type 2 diabetes mellitus.
3. Enrollment in the Travis AFB, CA EECP Clinic.
4. Department of Defense Beneficiary.
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: David Grant U.S. Air Force Medical Center

reference.citation: Martin JS, Beck DT, Aranda JM Jr, Braith RW. Enhanced external counterpulsation improves peripheral artery function and glucose tolerance in subjects with abnormal glucose tolerance. J Appl Physiol (1985). 2012 Mar;112(5):868-76. doi: 10.1152/japplphysiol.01336.2011. Epub 2011 Dec 22.

Bondesson SM, Edvinsson ML, Pettersson T, Edvinsson L. Reduced peripheral vascular reactivity in refractory angina pectoris: Effect of enhanced external counterpulsation. J Geriatr Cardiol. 2011 Dec;8(4):215-23. doi: 10.3724/SP.J.1263.2011.00215.

Braith RW, Conti CR, Nichols WW, Choi CY, Khuddus MA, Beck DT, Casey DP. Enhanced external counterpulsation improves peripheral artery flow-mediated dilation in patients with chronic angina: a randomized sham-controlled study. Circulation. 2010 Oct 19;122(16):1612-20. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.109.923482. Epub 2010 Oct 4.
